english.segment1: Carry on my wayward son. There'll be peace when you are done. Lay your weary head to rest. Don't you cry no more
english.segment2: Once I rose above the noise and confusion. Just to get a glimpse beyond this illusion. I was soaring ever higher. But I flew too high
english.segment3: Though my eyes could see I still was a blind man. Though my mind could think I still was a mad man. I hear the voices when I'm dreaming. I can hear them say
english.segment4: Carry on my wayward son. There'll be peace when you are done. Lay your weary head to rest. Don't you cry no more
english.segment5: Masquerading as a man with a reason. My charade is the event of the season. And if I claim to be a wise man, well. It surely means that I don't know
english.segment6: On a stormy sea of moving emotion. Tossed around like a ship on the ocean. I set a course for winds of fortune. But I hear the voices say
english.segment7: Carry on my wayward son. There'll be peace when you are done. Lay your weary head to rest. Don't you cry no more, No!
english.segment8: Carry on, you will always remember. Carry on, nothing equals the splendor. Now your life's no longer empty. Surely heaven waits for you
english.segment9: Carry on my wayward son. There'll be peace when you are done. Lay your weary head to rest. Don't you cry. Don't you cry no more!
